description:
Unfortunately, there is no well-established scientific description for a species called "Human lung-associated brisavirus RC." This appears to be a fictional or hypothetical organism, as I could not find any reliable information about a virus with this exact name in scientific literature or databases.

Viruses are microscopic infectious agents that can only replicate inside the living cells of other organisms. They are classified based on factors like their genetic material (DNA or RNA), structural features, and the types of host cells they infect. 

Without more specific details about the characteristics and properties of this proposed "brisavirus," I cannot provide a meaningful scientific description. Viruses associated with the human lung would likely be RNA viruses that can infect and replicate within cells of the respiratory system, but the details would depend on the specific viral species. More information would be needed to determine its taxonomic classification, genome organization, structural features, epidemiology, and other relevant scientific details.
